error.signature: template: index.html:10:5: executing "index.html" at <.Foo>: can't evaluate field Foo in type main.Data
error.regex: template:.*executing.*at <.*>:.*can't evaluate field|template:.*nil pointer evaluating|template:.*is not a method but has arguments

verdict.summary: Template execution failed because the data passed to the template does not match what the template expects. Common issues: unexported fields, missing fields, nil pointers in the template data, or calling methods with wrong arguments.

dead_ends.action: Use text/template instead of html/template to avoid escaping issues
dead_ends.why_fails: text/template has the same evaluation rules â€” switching template packages does not fix data/field mismatches, and removes XSS protection

workarounds.action: Ensure struct fields used in templates are exported (capitalized)
Use template.FuncMap to register custom functions
workarounds.condition: when template calls an unregistered function

leads_to.condition: when template data contains nil pointer fields

preceded_by.condition: when fixing Go source syntax leads to template execution errors

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Template execution errors reference template file/line and use template syntax, while reflect panics are raw 'reflect: call of reflect.Value.X on zero Value' from Go code.
